title: What is R?
text:
RStudio

Optional: posit Cloud
In case you don’t use a notebook where you can install R and RStudio, or you don’t want to, you can use the Posit Cloud service. It can be run in you browser, and provides the same functions and interface as if you were working with your own RStudio installation. And it’s free as well (at least 25 hours per month, but that should be more than enough for this workshop and propably for the following week).

Go to Posit Cloud.
Click on GET STARTED.
Create an account (it’s free) and login.
On the upper right, click on New Project. This will create a new RStudio project, which you can use the same way as described in this tutorial.



Structure of the RStudio interface

Script Pane


Console

"Hello World!"

[1] "Hello World!"


Tadaa, we just wrote our first line of code.

title: What is R?
text:
Workflow

Scripts
When only coding in our console we quickly run into the question where to save our code for further evaluation. Therefore, we want to write all our code that is worth saving into a script.


RStudio Projects
Over time, it will become increasingly hard to organize all your files, working directories and workspaces in a reasonable manner. For this, RStudio Projects can be used (highly recommended).


Exercises

Create a new folder folder for this tutorial, where all your files will go.
Create a new RStudio project and open it.
Create a new R Script and open it.

title: What is R?
text:
Packages

Package for this tutorial
There is a package available for this tutorial, which will provide interactive exercises. Please install:

title: R Workshop
text:
The following tutorial will teach you the basics of R. It is designed to be self paced, so you can work in you own tempo.



Learn the basics of programming in R as needed for the rest of the Open Research Summer School.
